msContents.summary: Land register which lists names and amounts of both crown and private land

msItemStruct.note: Two fragments, containing 4 columns. Column (iv) was not published in ed. pr
Written along the fibers; back blank
Col. I, 9 lines; col. II, 10 lines; col. III, 9 lines; col. IV, 8 lines; broken at bottom
Column iv published only in P.Sakaon 4
The hand is a clear cursive

supportDesc.support: 2 papyrus fragments; (a) 12 x 30 cm. (b) 12 x 6 cm

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: [col. I] Man-by-man land register of the village of Theadelphia in the 10th indiction. There are the following: Panous, priest, of the royal sown land, ar. 41 1/8 1/16; [l. 5] of the private sown land, ar. 6 1/4 1/16; Pasis son of Neilammon, of the private sown land, ar. 3 1/8; Sakaon son of Satabous, of the royal sown land, ar. 19 1/8; of the private sown land, ar. . . . [col. II] Psan son of Horion, of the royal sown land, ar. 33 1/4 1/8; of the private sown land, ar. 23 3/4 1/8 1/16 1/32; of the royal unsown land, ar. 2 3/4 1/16 1/64; [in marg.] investigate, Aeias daughter of Seras wife of Horion, of the royal sown land, ar. 8 1/4; [l. 5] Horion alias Kagol son of Heron, of the royal unsown land, ar. 12 1/32; Allion son of Satabous, of the royal sown land, ar. 6 1/12; of the private sown land, ar. 6 3/4 1/16 1/32; Esouris son of Horion , of the royal . . . ar. 10 1/4; . . . ar. 16 3/4 1/8 1/32. [col. III] Areion son of Dioskoros, of the royal sown land, ar. 5 1/16; of the private sown land, ar. 21 1/32; of the royal unsown land, ar. 2 1/16; of the private unsown land, ar. 1 3/4 1/8 1/16 1/32; [l. 5] Atiaina daughter of Dioskoros, of the private sown land, ar. 44 1/4 1/8; of the private unsown land, ar. 3 1/8 1/32; Sakaon son of Pemoutios, of the private sown land, ar. 1 1/4 1/12; Amis son of Paesios, of the royal sown land, ar. 1 1/4 1/8; [col. IV] in the consulship of the illustrious Neoptianus and Facundus, Choiak . . . Theadelphia . . . two hundred ninety two talents, total 292 talents . . . one hundred thirty talents, total 130 talents . . . total 14 talents.
